A teen was lured by his girlfriend into the woods and killed by three other boys for $500.00
 Here are some links to the story:
 
 http://www.bradenton.com/mld/bradenton/6032256.htm
 
 http://www.tri-cityherald.com/24hour/nation/story/910179p-6338834c.html
 
 http://abcnews.go.com/sections/GMA/US/GMA030625Teen_murder_plot.html
 
 The question of course is not whether they are guilty or not, but what their "punishment" should be. 
 Life in Prison?
 Death Penalty?
 50 years in Prison?
 
 What do you think and why....
 
 Thanks for reading this
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

I don't agree with my reply to the poll I should have thought it out more.
 
 I do agree more with life in prison more than death penalty though
 
 If the kids knew they were going to get killed for it and they did it so that they would be killed then I think life in prison, because we want them to know and understand taht what they did has a price, a consiquence. If the kids did it for kiks, to be more populary in school then thats a little different but its hard to decide the punishment

Debatequeen,
 
 "If the kids knew they were going to get killed for it and they did it so that they would be killed then I think life in prison,"
 
 - I'm pretty sure the kids intention was not to get the kids killed. In fact there are very few people who disagree that they killed him for the money, which is what they said they did it for. 
 Please read atleast one of the articles..... :) 
 
 " If the kids did it for kiks, to be more populary in school "
 
 - They also did not do it for this.....
 
 Most say they were simply cold blooded heartless killers. Afterwards they had a group hug and robbed him. Later while in court they were all seen giggiling (sp) together while their lawyer was talking with the judge.
 Please take that into consideration.
 
 Thanks for reading this
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

they seem a little funny in the head, although, i do not agree with capital punishment or life sentences. scratch that, sometimes i am for life sentence, for this, no. 
 
 these kids will have a lot of thinking to do in jail.

Crim,
 
 Is one death worthy of four more?
 Please provide some reasons for your opinion.
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

To maliciously take the life of another, have no remorse for the taking of that life, and then to find humor in the event says to me that these are 4 kids we really don't need. Cull the herd. Death penalty.
I would say torture and kill the little bastards
Silent, because scumbag punks like these are not needed in society

Death Penalty for all of them for murdering one person?, yeah that makes sense, Im sure if it were four 30 year olds that did the same thing, you wouldn't want to the death penalty. Anyway, all the girl did was lead him into the trap, not kill him, but you conservatives want to kill her anyway? Its really unfair how teenagers get punished more than adults who commit the same crimes. They will probably get life. If they were above 30 they would of probably got something like 10 years instead. Our form of "Justice" is anti-teen.
What judges give those easy sentences? Maybe Liberal judges?
exactly, maybe giving a line about how they are kids and may still be able to "turn themselves around to productive adults" . . . right or just go murder someone again

Morfos,
 
 "Anyway, all the girl did was lead him into the trap, not kill him, but you conservatives want to kill her anyway?"
 
 - All Osama did was give a little money twoards an operation. You can't downplay anyones role in this crime.
 I would have to agree that the death penatly is in order.
 As far as punishment goes gender is COMPLETELY irrelevant.

Silent, because scumbag punks like these are not needed in society

 
 Mentally handicapped people aren't needed in society, so do we kill them? That's not a very good argument. 
 
 I believe that they should get a couple decades in jail, but not that we should kill them. I mean, if they were giggling about it later, they're obviously not of sound mind, and need some serious therapy, and lots of jail time.
Dragon, being mentally handicapped does not infringe on people's rights (or in this case, destroy all of them).

Dragongirl,
 
 They knew right from wrong. 
 They carefully planned this crime.
 Why do they deserve therapy or a second chance?
 
 Their victim got no second chance.
 
 Always Stay Open Minded
Could the people who voted that the 3 teens should receive less than life please explain why they chose that option?
that is pure evil that is! I know 2 wrongs don't make a right, but death is the only punishment as severe as the one they deserve!

I assume by life sentaces that you mean in jail for their natural life, rather than a Life Sentance (about 20 years or so). They didn't torture him, its just a murder (as bad as that sounds) so shouldn't be treated any different that any other planned homocide would be.
 
 There is something wrong in their heads that would make them do it, if they can be 'cured' (it does happen, what they have done probably hasn't sunk in yet give it a few a years and then it probably will have done). If it hasn't then don't let them out, same way as it should be for all crimes really.
